author: kapsiR
body: Since PowerShell [v7.0.2](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.0.2) has been released several days ago, when will the [global tool](https://www.nuget.org/packages/PowerShell/) be updated?

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: Just released this morning. Thanks for filing the issue!

comments.author: tudor07
comments.body:
@kapsiR How to update powershell?
I tried running `dotnet tool install --global PowerShell --version 7.0.2` but when I restart Terminal I still see powershell 7.0.1

comments.author: kapsiR
comments.body:
@tudor07 When you want to update to the latest stable version, use `dotnet tool update -g powershell`.

**Important: Don't execute this within PowerShell, it can't update itself. (Close all instances of PowerShell and use cmd instead)**

comments.author: tudor07
comments.body:
@kapsiR Still not working.
1. I closed all instances of PowerShell
2. Launch cmd
3. Run `dotnet tool update -g powershell` in cmd
4. Open Windows Terminal
5. This is what I see:
```
PowerShell 7.0.1

...

 A new PowerShell stable release is available: v7.0.2
```

EDIT: Installed `.msi` package and it worked
